Articles.Content:
Hi all am a newcomer to KSP got the game just over a week ago and have been having a fantastic time. I also admit I am possibly the worst pilot in the games history. My hand eye coordination is pretty bad hence the poor skills. I normal rely on mechjeb for getting into a good orbit but ive been slowly improving without it. My ideas are very varied and wild to say the least .

At the moment I have about 5 crazy orbits about the sun, 1 Kerbal that was on a vector of his own due to me not being able to return him to his ship, after a while I took pity and decided euthanasia was the best option for the poor soul. I also have about 20 odd ships between kerbin and minmus. Most of which are out of fuel and do not have docking ports on . I have tried looking at and using a lot of the tutorials on the net and some fantastic work by scott manley. I still however cannot work out how to dock with other ships or even get into orbit of other worlds. On my limited success I have created some amazing looking craft and one perfectly flyable plane and rover.

Hope to chat with many of you soon and read and look at ur amazing creations. Many thanks to the devs for a fantastic game that looks, feels and runs better than many a big budget game.

Happy flying all

Heya Britguy32 and welcome to the forums!

Yeah I can also recommend Scott Manleys tutorials. That guy has some serious knowledge

Happy flying and watch out for the space kraken!

Welcome to the forums!

Heya Britguy32 and welcome to the forums!

Yeah I can also recommend Scott Manleys tutorials. That guy has some serious knowledge

Happy flying and watch out for the space kraken!

What this guy said, him along with Trydyingtolive (Look them up on youtube) are who taught me all I know about the game.

Also, just keep flying as your brain has to get used to the controls

Meh, not that bad. I mean, who flips a lander over, and not being able to do anything about it be on it side after trying for 45 minutes, me. And I've had multiple craft fly into each other upon docking attempt, but hey, Practice makes perfect. Keep trying. You'll be there someday.
